column4: A friend of mine wants to install to empty space on a hard drive with a 2.2TB Windows partition. However, he gets an error saying that this is not possible.
I've never seen this before. What's going on?
probably a gpt issue. what version of the installer is he using
Latest one - just burnt.
He's trying to use the default "install alongside windows" option. However, anything I suggest seems to be throwing the same error message.
try the manual partitioning
It doesn't seem to be working, though I am helping someone remotely (augh.)
I get" Error: partition length of 7762061790 sectors exceeds the msdos-partition-table-imposed maximum". It seems to be preventing the ubuntu installer from doing anything.
well if he has an msdos partition table on a 2.2TB disk then the end of the disk is inaccessbile
he could try and switch to gpt using gdisk, and perhaps he has a hybrid gpt/msdos partition table which could confuse things
install and use gdisk to figure out what is going on
It's just a standard Win7 install.
that doesnt mean much
When I say "standard win7 install", I mean that there's nothing on the disk but Win7 and some empty space.
again that doesnt mean much
Huh. Should shrinking the NTFS partition fix it?
install and use gdisk
It throws an error.
disk throws an error?
gdisk that is
this documentation is very thorough http://www.rodsbooks.com/gdisk/
